page.title: 05HISTORICAL BUILDINGS
page.content: Old farm buildings at lambside still in use. The ruined{Membland Pleasure {House,}an 18th century summer house at Beacon Hill with spectacular sea views. The ruined Church of St.Peter (see Ecclesiastical). Query an Iron Age Hill Fort? at Hewsters Hill near Great Pideaux Farm overlooking Noss Creek. St. Anchorite Rock is a prominent coastal feature at Carswell, the legend being that a hermit once lived there. The adjoining stone quarry provided stone for buildings, particularly Alstan Hall. Membland Hall was the seat of the local estate owner. For instance in 1801 he was a Mr.Perring who was Lord Mayor of London. About 1970 the area was acquired by Edward Baring,Later Lord Revelstoke,who erected farmbuildings at Keaton,Carswell and Caulston,which are picturesque and a particular stile
